comment:
@TheChadColby 2 x 4s were originally cut 2 x 4, before drying. Green oak was the wood used in early 1900s & the standard, usually locally sourced. 
Oak can't be nailed unless it is green & shrinkage occurred after homes built.

comment: @TheChadColby In 50s & 60's production mills developed using FIR/PINE, & KLIN DRYING became the standard to dry wood to a certain % of moisture, which shrinks a 2 x 4 to 1.5 x 3.5. Today, cheaper cuts of timber are shrunk more to adjust for moisture content & no shrinking after build. I think
